com.shea.tothepathandback

Class Directions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shea.tothepathandback.Directions

  • public class Directions
extends java.lang.Object
    We use the Directions class for multiple tasks, but they all relate to the obtaining and parsing of the JSON data retrieved by an Directions API call. With Directions, we can create the URL(s) that we would need to connect with. Then we're able to connect to the given URL(s) in order to download the directions in JSON format. We can then call a way to parse through all those directions in order to later create a Map view of the waypoints and street directions.
    Author:
    shea

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Directions.DownloadAllData
      Extends AsyncTask to try and fetch JSON data from each String URL of each station in background when executed.
      static class  Directions.DownloadTask
      Starts fetching/downloading JSON data from single URL passed In background, it will download the JSON data provided by the URL passed through
      static class  Directions.ParserTask
      In the background parse through the JSON data contained in a passed String

    • Method Detail

      • getUrl

        public static java.lang.String getUrl(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng origin,
                      com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng destination)
        Returns a String that represents the URL that'll be used to call the Directions API
        Parameters:
        origin - - Contains the latitude and longitude that represent origin location
        destination - - Contains the latitude and longitude that represent destination location
        Returns:
        a String containing the URL text for Directions API call

      • downloadFromURL

        private static java.lang.String downloadFromURL(java.lang.String str_URL)

        With a given URL string, returns JSON data retrieved after an attempt to open and connect with the URL and saving it with a string buffer.

        Parameters:
        str_URL - - String containing Directions API call URL
        Returns:
        String containing all JSON directional data returned from calling URL

      • getAllURLS

        public static java.lang.String[] getAllURLS(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng origin,
                            Station[] stations)

        With a passed array of stations and the latitude and longitude of the current location, we call getURL() to create a String of the URL that we'll use to obtain directions. We call getURL() in each iteration.

        Parameters:
        origin - - LatLng object that we'll use as the origin for the URL
        stations - - An array of Station objects that we'll use each as a destination for the URL
        Returns:
        an array of Strings, each represents a Directions API URL from the origin to each station
        See Also:
        getUrl(LatLng, LatLng)
